intro: Volkmannia japonica, commonly known as the Japanese volkmannia, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other umbelliferous plants. Volkmannia japonica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas.
